docs.lead_paragraph: The first sports work stoppage of the social networking era has left N.F.L. players concerned, confused and a little distracted. But they were chatty and - at least temporarily - united.

headline.main: Players Have Plenty to Say, in Short Bursts

docs.abstract: The first sports work stoppage of the social networking era has left N.F.L. players concerned, confused and a little distracted. But they were chatty and - at least temporarily - united.
docs.snippet: The first sports work stoppage of the social networking era has left N.F.L. players concerned, confused and a little distracted. But they were chatty and - at least temporarily - united.

docs.lead_paragraph: David Rosen, the hospital executive accused of being involved in a corruption scheme, says he has paid a consultancy fee or two to politicians, but never a bribe, to save hospitals.

headline.seo: Charges Against Health Care Executive Raise Broader Issues
headline.main: Charges Against Health Care Executive Raise Broader Issues
headline.print_headline: Charges Against Health Care Executive Raises Broader Issues

docs.snippet: David Rosen, the hospital executive accused of being involved in a corruption scheme, says he has paid a consultancy fee or two to politicians, but never a bribe, to save hospitals.

docs.lead_paragraph: A law on light bulb efficiency due to take effect next year has brought a frenzy of activity to get the law repealed or, at least, to stockpile the bulbs before they disappear from store shelves.

headline.seo: Law on Light Bulb Efficiency Angers Conservatives
headline.main: Give Up Familiar Light Bulb? Not Without Fight, Some Say
headline.print_headline: Give Up Familiar Light Bulb? Not Without Fight, Some Say

docs.snippet: A law on light bulb efficiency due to take effect next year has brought a frenzy of activity to get the law repealed or, at least, to stockpile the bulbs before they disappear from store shelves.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Scott Walker said that the approval of a bill cutting benefits will save enough money to avoid 1,500 layoffs, but that won’t be the end of the battle over the future of unions.

headline.seo: Wisconsin Union Bill Is Law, but Debate Is Far From Over
headline.main: Union Bill Is Law, but Debate Is Far From Over
headline.print_headline: Union Bill Is Law, but Debate Is Far From Over

docs.snippet: Gov. Scott Walker said that the approval of a bill cutting benefits will save enough money to avoid 1,500 layoffs, but that won’t be the end of the battle over the future of unions.

docs.lead_paragraph: Payments to the 9/11 rescue and cleanup workers who settled their lawsuits with New York City last year are going out on schedule, lawyers for the two sides said, even if thousands of the plaintiffs have yet to see any money.

headline.main: Payments to 9/11 Workers Are Off to Slow Start

docs.abstract: Small initial payments have gone out to many of the more than 10,000 rescue workers who settled a lawsuit over health claims related to the 9/11 terrorist attacks. But the bulk of the money has yet to be distributed.
docs.snippet: Small initial payments have gone out to many of the more than 10,000 rescue workers who settled a lawsuit over health claims related to the 9/11 terrorist attacks. But the bulk of the money has yet to be distributed.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a new PowerPoint presentation, Mary Meeker examines U.S. finances as if the country were a business, then asks what a turnaround expert would do to put USA Inc. back in the black.

headline.main: Analyzing the U.S. Like a Business
headline.print_headline: Analyzing the U.S. Like a Business

docs.snippet: In a new PowerPoint presentation, Mary Meeker examines U.S. finances as if the country were a business, then asks what a turnaround expert would do to put USA Inc. back in the black.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tyler Cowen had two posts at Marginal Revolution this week listing what he believed were the common sins of left-wing economists and right-wing economists. Kevin Drum then offered a point-by-point response to the left's list, which in turn inspired this post.

headline.main: Economic Blind Spots, Left and Right

docs.abstract: Liberals and liberal economists don't necessarily have the same blind spots.
docs.snippet: Liberals and liberal economists don't necessarily have the same blind spots.

docs.lead_paragraph: A response to an article about Senate’s reluctance to appointing Dr. Donald M. Berwick.
docs.snippet: A response to an article about Senate’s reluctance to appointing Dr. Donald M. Berwick.

docs.lead_paragraph: Having a “what were they thinking?” moment recently.
docs.snippet: Having a “what were they thinking?” moment recently.

docs.lead_paragraph: The decision by equipment reconditioners will force football programs to buy new helmets or put youngsters in used helmets known to be less safe.

headline.seo: Equipment Group Says It Will No Longer Refurbish Old Helmets
headline.main: Group to Phase Out Old Football Helmets
headline.print_headline: Group to Phase Out Old Football Helmets

docs.abstract: National Athletic Equipment Reconditioners Assn, known as Naera, which oversees refurbishing of used helmets worn by nearly 100,000 young players every fall, announces it will no longer accept football helmets more than 10 years old due to safety concerns.
docs.snippet: The decision by equipment reconditioners will force football programs to buy new helmets or put youngsters in used helmets known to be less safe.
